review: I use the TMVEL "HDMI to Composite" converter here [http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0091VF4FA] and it works as it should. Both the chromecast and converter needs external power. So keep it in mind before you buy.Chromecast is a excellent product, especially if you have android phone. There are tons of apps for android. For playing local files saved on android device, use the free ES File Explorer app(works like a charm!)For people with old TVs, note that there are two types of converters (HDMI to Composite and HDMI to Component) Composite has three pins and component has five pins. Composite is enough for most purposes. The price range for these converters are form 20$ to even 100$. The TMVEL converter that I have works very well with my very old TV and it costed me 30$.
